driving_suggestion: While remaining in the current lane, pay attention to observe whether construction vehicles deviate unexpectedly. Take note of any possible road changes or directions on the overhead signs, but there is no need for immediate action at this time. Continue to follow standard driving rules, maintain a safe distance from other vehicles, and travel at an appropriate speed based on road conditions and traffic laws. Due to the presence of construction trucks and signs indicating road curves, the vehicle should maintain a cautious speed and be ready to change lanes when necessary. Additionally, the driver should be vigilant for any temporary traffic lights or construction workers directing traffic, as these situations can alter the normal traffic pattern and require special attention. The vehicle should keep a safe following distance from construction vehicles, be prepared to respond to potential stops or turns of large vehicles, and drive at a speed suitable for wet and slippery road conditions. Furthermore, keep an eye on the overhead directional signs to ensure the vehicle stays in the correct lane of the intended route.

The ego vehicle should proceed with caution, maintain a safe distance, and be prepared for potential stops or detours as the construction vehicle may indicate the presence of a construction zone ahead.
